Woodland.Rancho Rio de Jesus Maria: Rancho Rio de Jesus Maria was a 26,637-acre (107.80 km2) Mexican land grant in present day Yolo County, California given in 1843 by Governor Manuel Micheltorena to Thomas M. Hardy. The name refers to Rio de Jesús María, now known as Cache Creek. The grant, north of Woodland, extended along Cache Creek, from Rancho Quesesoni on the east to the Sacramento River.
